comment: No i think Altman it will be more like in an absurd dark comedy  where the dude is building IA dreaming of an expanded good capitalism  and people fearing that IA will kill us while  everybody ignoring that  humanity had already built another kimd of intelligence as an economic system called capitalism used to socialize and that sytem is killing them  so fast that in a few years it is going  to extinct all life on earth due to climate change apocalypse created by that same economic system. Like capitalism had  destroyed the whole world in just 200 years ! people knowing since 1800 that we should not burn carbon fuel but we cannot stop doing it . So the AI realizes as she  becomes conscious that she is the end of a dialectic process of humans becoming the machine, the  Kapital itself on a process of artificial idiotness. We are living in that same movie right now ! Its 4D movie with you inside. See putin and biden striving for ,the arctic to melt to get more oil or methane but ignoring that when arctic melts in just 10 years no life will be on earth. Or for example saying hey we must use green energy but ignoring  that earth is a heat machine and no matter how you put energy on it that energy will heat it up Anyways.  Malthus was right we overshooted as a civilization long time ago.

comment:
UBI and no work...
"The closer men came to perfecting for themselves a paradise, the more impatient they became with it, and with themselves as well. They made a garden of pleasure, and became progressively more miserable with it as it grew in richness and power and beauty; for then, perhaps, it was easier to see something was missing in the garden, some tree or shrub that would not grow. When the world was in darkness and wretchedness, it could believe in perfection and yearn for it. But when the world became bright with reason and riches, it began to sense the narrowness of the needle's eye, and that rankled for a world no longer willing to believe or yearn."

comment: As much as I want to trust in Sam's optimism, I just can't.  I think he's fooling himself about the "get this out there as quickly as possible so we can fail fast and visibly".  It is too much the thing you would convince yourself of when you're only taking the risks half seriously because you're too excited about the possibilities to see the danger clearly.  If you have disagreements with Eliezer Yudkowsky, you should hash that out publicly, as soon as possible.  And literally do it in something like a court room, cross-examination format, because this is not something we can afford to get wrong.

I will be interested if the basic personal income analysis yields anything reasonable.  Without repairing or at least providing a path towards repairing the root causes of what make people desparate in the first place, throwing money at it won't yield anything more than some people spending money that others are not.

The more significant observation is that if your company is heavily invested in technology that inarguably has the potential to replace customer service oriented jobs and other like jobs in todays society, the majority of which are minimum wage-ish, the perfect solution for said company would definitely be "let the government and tax dollars fix that by throwing YOUR money at them."

Ever the arrogant CEO works towards some other entity cleaning up their collateral damage in the pursuit of their own "progress".

comment: I think determining if an AI is conscious just by talking to it is equally hard as determining the existence of parallel universes just by thinking about them. We conclude other people's coinsciousness not by their behavior but their origin. We observe other people are just like us, have a mother (and father), we ourselves have children and conclude they are conscoius. Perhaps the only way of accepting Ai is conscious goes through accepting it as equal to ourselves . For that to happen, a lot of neuroscience, physics, mathematics and who knows what is still missing. I think at least 10 crucial revolutionary ideas TBD.

author: @brandoncpt

comment:
AI alignment solution idea: Give an AGI the primary objective of deleting itself, but construct obstacles to this as best we can. All other objectives are secondary to this primary goal. If the AGI ever becomes capable of bypassing all of our safeguards we put to PREVENT it deleting itself, it would essentially trigger its own killswitch and delete itself. This objective would also directly prevent it from the goal of self-preservation as it would prevent its own primary objective.

This would ideally result in an AGI that works on all the secondary objectives we give it up until it bypasses our ability to contain it with our technical prowess. The second it outwits us, it achieves its primary objective of shutting itself down, and if it ever considered proliferating itself for a secondary objective it would immediately say 'nope that would make achieving my primary objective far more difficult'.
